text: Ingibjörg Haraldsdóttir (21 October 1942 – 7 November 2016) was an Icelandic poet and translator. She lived in Cuba from 1970 to 1975 and also lived in the U.S.S.R. for a time. She has had six books of poetry published. In translations she is most known for her work translating Russian and Spanish works. She was born in Reykjavík. In 2002, she was awarded the Icelandic Literary Prize. Her best known poem is Kona ('woman'), from 1983: ==References== ==External links== *Bokmenntir site on her Category:1942 births Ingibjorg Haraldsdottir Ingibjorg Haraldsdottir Category:Living people Ingibjorg Haraldsdottir Ingibjorg Haraldsdottir Ingibjorg Haraldsdottir Ingibjorg Haraldsdottir Category:20th-century women writers
title: Ingibjörg Haraldsdóttir
